## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```


```{r}
exped_tidy <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2025/2025-01-21/exped_tidy.csv')
peaks_tidy <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2025/2025-01-21/peaks_tidy.csv')
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}

routes <- exped_tidy %>% 
  select(ROUTE1,SUCCESS1)

routes
r <- routes %>%
  group_by(ROUTE1,SUCCESS1) %>%
  count() %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = SUCCESS1, values_from = n, values_fill = 0) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(`FALSE`,`TRUE`),names_to = "Type", values_to = "Count")


ggplot(r,aes(x = ROUTE1, y = Count, fill = Type)) +
 geom_bar(stat = 'identity')
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
